name: Listened to WWDC 2022: Apple’s iOS 16, new M2 processor, macOS Ventura, and more

content.html:
The Verge’s Nilay Patel, David Pierce, and Alex Cranz discuss all the important announcements from Apple’s WWDC. Also: USB-C will be mandatory for phones sold in the EU ‘by autumn 2024 and the Xbox game streaming TV app feels almost like the real thing All stories discussed this week: Apple announces new flagship M2 processor Apple announces redesigned MacBook Air with M2 chip and MagSafe MacBook Air and Pro (2022) versus MacBook Pros (2021): spec comparison Apple CarPlay is expanding with new features that can integrate deeper into the car Apple iOS 16 brings massive improvements to lock screen and messages Live Activities is a new iOS 16 feature meant to improve notifications Apple will let you edit and even unsend texts in Messages in iOS 16 Apple announces all-new Home app at WWDC iPadOS 16 takes a step closer to laptop-level multitasking Apple’s macOS 13 Ventura with new Stage Manager tool announced at WWDC You’ll soon be able to use an iPhone as a Mac webcam Continuity Camera: Apple explains how your…

By The Vergecast
content.value:
